title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in blowout win vs. the Panthers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots In total, Marcus Jones tallied 167 punt return yards, setting a new single-game franchise record.
Patriots' Marcus Jones celebrates after his punt return touchdown against the Panthers.

AP Photo/Charles Krupa FOXBOROUGH – Marcus Jones’s appetite for risk, fielding a punt with two Carolina Panthers players within striking distance as he caught it, put the Patriots on the scoreboard and sparked a run of three consecutive touchdowns that put the game out of reach early.

bullets: Boston Celtics "Thank you, Boston.

title: Jayson Tatum shares video of on-court workout amid Achilles injury recovery
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics “It’s been a long journey, 19 and a half weeks but I always say brighter days ahead.

title: 7 takeaways from Patriots’ 42-13 win over Panthers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots A dominant performance on special teams from Marcus Jones helped set the stage for a blowout on Sunday in Foxborough.

title: Webster man indicted, arrested for allegedly setting Southbridge fire that displaced 12 families
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The Webster man was charged with two counts each of arson of a dwelling and malicious damage to a motor vehicle.
A Webster man was indicted and arrested for allegedly setting a Southbridge fire that displaced 12 families.

Southbridge Fire Department By Darin Zullo September 28, 2025 | 10:50 AM 1 minute to read A Webster man was arrested Thursday after being indicted for allegedly setting a fire that tore through two multi-family homes and displaced 12 families, according to officials.

title: Man found dead in van on Rehoboth property identified, prosecutors say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The man and his wife were found by a relative in a van, which police say they had been living out of for a few weeks.
By Darin Zullo September 28, 2025 | 10:08 AM 1 minute to read A man who was found dead in a van at a Rehoboth property Friday has been identified, according to prosecutors.
David Lunn, 54, was found dead in a “workstyle van” at 107 County St.

title: Newton psychologist to plead guilty to fraud, money laundering, allegedly fell victim to scam
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The Newton psychologist allegedly invested $600,000 of his patient’s money overseas after falling victim to a confidence scam.

By Darin Zullo September 28, 2025 | 9:19 AM 1 minute to read A Newton psychologist will plead guilty to allegedly defrauding his psychotherapy patient and one of his own relatives, prosecutors said Friday.
Eric Brown, 76, was charged with two counts of wire fraud and one count of engaging in an unlawful money transaction and has agreed to plead guilty, according to the U.
